div.p: I had to save £3000 the first time and then someone robbed my house and I wasn’t insured then I had to save another £2000
and then I got the camera, I got stuff back like you know back on my feet and then it’s all money, yeah it’s all my money now
you know but they were the biggest impacts like you know that £3000 then about a year later my house got robbed that
I could have gone any direction, I could have just started robbing houses, you know, robbing shops, whatever like you know
to get that money, you know, I want that money back, you know, even so but I stuck at it like you know thankfully there was people
that said “do you want to do a job?” you know I said “yeah alright then” then obviously saving up money and then like
then doing that, yeah, saving up that sort of money and then putting that work in you’ve got that, you’ve got so much pride
in yourself, you’re proud of yourself, I did this, F*** everyone else, who’s saying “oh it’ll be alright” trying to pretend
that they’re your friends but then they won’t support you in any other way you do it yourself and you know you get that,
I don’t know what’s the word, you can soak in that glory a little bit more like you know you can say I’ve done that
like saying a personal, a proud personal achievement when you’ve put the work in and you can see for yourself what you’ve done
forget what everyone else sees if you know how hard you’ve put the work in and you can see something out of it it’s a real good feeling.
